intro: Xystrolobos yunnanensis var. calospatha, commonly known as the Yunnan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers. The plant has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its vibrant floral display.
